data.title: Orhan Pamuk Book List
data.meta_description: A complete list of all Orhan Pamuk's books in order (12 books). Browse plot descriptions, book covers, genres, pseudonyms, ratings and awards.
data.text:
The Black Book

Aug-1994

/ Suspense

Galip is a lawyer living in Istanbul. His wife, the detective novel-loving Ruya, has disappeared. Could she have left him for her ex-husband, Cel�l, a popular newspaper columnist? But Cel�l, too, seems to have vanished. As Galip investigates, he find...

The New Life

Apr-1997

/ General Fiction

Osman is a young university student whose life is changed by a chance encounter with a mysterious book. Osman becomes obsessed with the book, which seems to contain all the magic and power of life and love. Romantic and elusive, Orhan Pamuk's The New...

The White Castle

Apr-1998

/ General Fiction

From the Nobel Prize winner and the acclaimed author of My Name is Red comes a dazzling work of historical fiction and a treatise on the enigma of identity and the relations between East and West.From a Turkish writer who has been compared with Borge...

My Name Is Red

Sep-2001

/ General Fiction

The Nobel Prize winner and one of today's most prominent contemporary Turkish writers delivers a novel that is a fiendishly devious mystery, a beguiling love story, a brilliant symposium on the power of art, and a “modern classic … rich and essen...

Snow

Aug-2004

/ General Fiction

An exiled poet named Ka returns to Turkey and travels to the forlorn city of Kars. His ostensible purpose is to report on a wave of suicides among religious girls forbidden to wear their head scarves. But Ka is also drawn by his memories of the radia...

Istanbul

Jul-2006

/ General Fiction

From the Nobel Prize winner and acclaimed author of My Name is Red comes a portrait of Istanbul by its foremost writer, revealing the melancholy that comes of living amid the ruins of a lost empire. "Delightful, profound, marvelo...

Other Colours

Sep-2007

/ General Fiction

Knopf Canada is proud to welcome Orhan Pamuk to the list with an inspiring and engaging collection of essays on literary and personal subjects�"his first new book since winning the Nobel Prize.

In the three decades that Pamuk has devoted to w...

The Museum of Innocence

Oct-2009

/ General Fiction

"It was the happiest moment of my life, though I didn't know it." So begins the new novel, his first since winning the Nobel Prize, from the universally acclaimed author of Snow and My Name Is Red.It is 1975, a perfect spring in Istanbul. Kemal, scio...

Silent House

Oct-2012

/ Literary

Never before published in English, Orhan Pamuk’s second novel is the story of a Turkish family gathering in the shadow of the impending military coup of 1980. In an old mansion in Cennethisar, a former fishing village near Istanbul, a widow, Fat...

A Strangeness in My Mind

Oct-2015

/ Literary

From the Nobel Prize winner and best-selling author of SNOW and MY NAME IS RED: a soaring, panoramic new novel -- his first since THE MUSEUM OF INNOCENCE -- telling the unforgettable tale of an Istanbul street vendor and the love of his life. Sin...

The Red-Haired Woman

Aug-2017

/ Literary

A fable of fathers and sons and the desires that come between them. On the outskirts of a town thirty miles from Istanbul, a master well digger and his young apprentice are hired to find water on a barren plain. As they struggle in the summer hea...

Nights of Plague

Oct-2022

/ Literary

From the the winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature: Part detective story, part historical epic -- a bold and brilliant novel that imagines a plague ravaging a fictional island in the Ottoman Empire.It is April 1900, in the Levant, on the imagi...
